thread.title: HURRICANE PATRICIA: Families are gathering under one roof to ‘brace it together’
thread.title_full: HURRICANE PATRICIA: Families are gathering under one roof to ‘brace it together’ - Press Enterprise

author: ALEJANDRA MOLINA
title: HURRICANE PATRICIA: Families are gathering under one roof to ‘brace it together’
text:
By ALEJANDRA MOLINA / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 23, 2015 Updated: 10:36 p.m. RELATED INLAND: Locals worry about relatives, ready to help
INLAND: Local ham operators watching storm's progress
Betty Sanchez, of Coachella, had to detach herself from constantly checking news updates of the hurricane Friday, Oct. 23.
“I was crying, to be honest,” Sanchez said.
Sanchez has family in Puerto Vallarta and Talpa.
Her cousins in Puerto Vallarta have been keeping her updated through a private Facebook chat group. Many of her family members are gathering in the same house to “brace it together,” she said.
“I just can’t even imagine what type of horror awaits,” Sanchez said.
With winds near 200 mph, Patricia is the strongest storm ever recorded in Western Hemisphere. Mexican officials declared a state of emergency in dozens of municipalities in Colima, Nayarit and Jalisco states, and schools were closed.
Sanchez said structures are built to withstand winds and the hurricane, but it’s the flooding she’s concerned about.
“My closest comparison is Katrina, where you see images of people stranded on top of their roofs,” she said. “I can’t even imagine what could possibly happen.”
Contact the writer: amolina@pe.com or 951-368-9462
